results.title: Simvastatin, edaravone and dexamethasone protect against kainate-induced brain endothelial cell damage
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Edaravone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077553 @@@edaravone@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Dexamethasone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003907 @@@dexamethasone@@@ protect against @CHEMICAL_Kainic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007608 @@@kainate@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Corneal_Endothelial_Cell_Loss</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055954 @@@brain endothelial cell damage@@@

citations.NLM: Barna L, Walter FR, Harazin A, Bocsik A, Kincses A, Tubak V, Jósvay K, Zvara Á, Campos-Bedolla P, Deli MA. Simvastatin, edaravone and dexamethasone protect against kainate-induced brain endothelial cell damage Fluids Barriers CNS. 2020 Feb 10;17(1):5. PMID: 32036791

results.title: Simvastatin reduces high uric acid-induced oxidative stress and inflammatory response in vascular endothelial cells via nuclear factor E2-related factor 2 (Nrf2) signaling
results.text_hl: ... @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@ alleviated the @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ response as well as inhibiting oxidative stress through the @GENE_NFE2L2 @GENE_4780 @@@Nrf2@@@ pathway, thereby attenuating high @CHEMICAL_Uric_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014527 @@@UA@@@-induced vascular @<m>DISEASE_Corneal_Endothelial_Cell_Loss</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055954 @@@endothelial cell injury@@@.

citations.NLM: Chen X, Xie L, Wu W. Simvastatin reduces high uric acid-induced oxidative stress and inflammatory response in vascular endothelial cells via nuclear factor E2-related factor 2 (Nrf2) signaling Iran J Basic Med Sci. 2023;26(8):927-933. PMID: 37427319

results.title: Simvastatin and markers of endothelial function in patients undergoing continuous ambulatory peritoneal dialysis.
results.text_hl: The aim of this study was to assess the effects of a 6-month treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (10 mg at bedtime) on markers of @<m>DISEASE_Corneal_Endothelial_Cell_Loss</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055954 @@@endothelial cell injury@@@ in 12 @DISEASE_Hyperlipoproteinemia_Type_II @DISEASE_MESH:D006938 @@@hypercholesterolemic@@@ CAPD @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

citations.NLM: Malyszko J, Malyszko JS, Hryszko T, Brzosko S, Mysliwiec M. Simvastatin and markers of endothelial function in patients undergoing continuous ambulatory peritoneal dialysis. Int J Tissue React. 2002;24(3):111-5. PMID: 12635864

results.title: Increased soluble CD40L levels are reduced by long-term simvastatin treatment in peritoneally dialyzed patients.
results.text_hl: AIM: To determine the effects of 6 months treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ on @DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@platelet aggregation@@@, markers of @<m>DISEASE_Corneal_Endothelial_Cell_Loss</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055954 @@@endothelial cell injury@@@, and sCD40L in 15 hyperlipidemic CAPD @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

citations.NLM: Malyszko J, Malyszko JS, Hryszko T, Mysliwiec M. Increased soluble CD40L levels are reduced by long-term simvastatin treatment in peritoneally dialyzed patients. Blood Coagul Fibrinolysis. 2004 Sep;15(6):463-7. PMID: 15311154

results.title: Rapid reversal of endothelial dysfunction in hypercholesterolaemic rabbits treated with simvastatin and pravastatin.
results.text_hl: The main objective of the present study was to verify the speed with which two @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_100357791 @@@3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl coenzyme A reductase@@@ inhibitors, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@, could revert @<m>DISEASE_Corneal_Endothelial_Cell_Loss</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055954 @@@endothelial cell dysfunction@@@ in hypercholesterolaemic @SPECIES_9986 @@@rabbits@@@.

citations.NLM: Jorge PA, Osaki MR, de Almeida E. Rapid reversal of endothelial dysfunction in hypercholesterolaemic rabbits treated with simvastatin and pravastatin. Clin Exp Pharmacol Physiol. 1997 Dec;24(12):948-53. PMID: 9406661
citations.BibTeX: @article{9406661, title={Rapid reversal of endothelial dysfunction in hypercholesterolaemic rabbits treated with simvastatin and pravastatin.}, author={Jorge PA and Osaki MR and de Almeida E}, journal={Clin Exp Pharmacol Physiol}, volume={24}, number={12}, pages={948-53}}

results.title: Comparative benefits of simvastatin and exercise in a mouse model of vascular cognitive impairment and dementia
results.text_hl: Overall, results indicate that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SV@@@ and EX prevented @DISEASE_Cognition_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D003072 @@@cognitive decline@@@ in @DISEASE_Hyperlipoproteinemia_Type_II @DISEASE_MESH:D006938 @@@hypercholesterolemic@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ and that they share common sites of action in preventing @<m>DISEASE_Corneal_Endothelial_Cell_Loss</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055954 @@@endothelial cell dysfunction@@@ and reducing WM @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation.

citations.NLM: Trigiani LJ, Royea J, Tong XK, Hamel E. Comparative benefits of simvastatin and exercise in a mouse model of vascular cognitive impairment and dementia FASEB J. 2019 Dec;33(12):13280-13293. PMID: 31557051
citations.BibTeX: @article{31557051, title={Comparative benefits of simvastatin and exercise in a mouse model of vascular cognitive impairment and dementia}, author={Trigiani LJ and Royea J and Tong XK and Hamel E}, journal={FASEB J}, volume={33}, number={12}, pages={13280-13293}}
